website_summaries.verdict: Philips Hue is one of the best-developed DIY smart-home platforms money can buy, and this white-light starter kit is your most affordable entry point. It's practically a must-buy if you're serious about smart lighting.
pros: The plain, vanilla version of Philips Hue's smart LEDs don't change colors, but they do enjoy all of the benefits of Hue's well-connected platform
They're also bright, good looking bulbs with easy-to-use smarts, and you can add extras to your setup for just $15 each
cons: At $70, the two-bulb starter kit still comes with a fair share of sticker shock

customer_reviews.title: Very YELLOW colored light. Look at the attached picture ...
customer_reviews.text: Very YELLOW colored light. Look at the attached picture, these bulbs are as "warm" as they come. I wish I would have known they were this yellow beforehand. My fault. Unfortunately, I have to return these bulbs because I can't handle how drastically yellow they are. Wish I didn't have to pay more than double the price for their white ambiance bulbs, just to get a bulb that has natural "cool" light...
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Nearly burnt down the house.
customer_reviews.text: I got these yesterday and I was so excited! I had been wanting these for a while! I read the instructions and off I was getting everything set up. Connected it to router and made sure everything was working. It was yay! But then it kept saying it couldn't connect. If I wasn't on the same WiFi from home it wouldn't connect. Which sucks because I'm not always home. Then around 2am my dog started freaking out! And I get up to see what he wants and sparks are coming out of the outlet where I had connected this device!!! Had to unplug it and I'm very disappointed on the product. Will be returning and not buying again.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Shabbat Lifesaver!
customer_reviews.text: We are observant Jews, and these bulbs (and this hub) simplify our life so much! No more rushing around before Shabbat (the sabbath) setting light timers! No more waking up in the middle of the night to use the bathroom and being blinded by the transition from dark bedroom to bright bathroom! We set our Shabbat program ahead of time, including dimming the bathroom light at night. It repeats every week without any issues. The only weakness is this: if your WiFi doesn’t extend somewhere (like our bedroom), the bulbs might not be able to “talk” to the hub. Also, everything arrived speedily and packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Meggie OK

customer_reviews.title: I think I'll just stick with conventional bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I love warm/soft white lighting. This is not that. This is some sort of hellish orange. The receptor thingy also needs to be plugged into my router in order for me to use the phone app. When I use the phone app to turn off the light, one light remains on so I have to get out of bed to turn off the light anyway. And when I turn on the light, the same light will remain off. That one bulb just wants to do everything the opposite of what I want!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: it only sucks that the bulbs cost a lot
customer_reviews.text: The bulbs are pre-program into the hub. This is dead simple to setup. The fact is, it only sucks that the bulbs cost a lot. After this I found out going with something like SmartThings and some of their bulbs. The $50 color bulbs you get with Hue, you can get $12 from other places. On top of that, it really sucks how Hue doesn't have a wall switch nor seem to work with any on the market. The reason why I'm not dinging the review on this is I believe the review should reflect the product itself. But just note this.
customer_reviews.author: Craig T. Bennett II

customer_reviews.title: Misleading - These are Warm White, NOT White
customer_reviews.text: Functionality is fine, but these are not white bulbs as described. The color is very much yellow and the box actually says in tiny print "warm white". "Warm white" is not white!
customer_reviews.author: CairoKid

customer_reviews.title: Bad technology. Useless
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty lame and stupid technology. Biggest flaw: the bridge can only be hardwired. Meaning you need an Ethernet cable to connect the bridge to the internet. 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻... World is moving away. Some other lights doesn't even need the bridge. This product doesn't have color change feature. No where on the box it states that it connects or doesn't connect to WiFi directly. I was flying out and on a short notice ordered this. It arrived I installed it and found out that I cannot do anything with this. Cause I wanted to install this light in a fixture.. turns out you cannot use this light bulb in the fixtures or at least I read it's not recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmed

customer_reviews.title: ... actually don't want to publicly admit just how much fun I'm having with this system
customer_reviews.text: I actually don't want to publicly admit just how much fun I'm having with this system. It's perfect! One star off because the iPhone app is really sub-par. It works, but it's clearly designed by committee. Hey Philips? Call me if you're looking for an app developer who could make this thing sing, ok? Just saying! I might even consider being payed in more light bulbs! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of problems, and poor support
customer_reviews.text: Too many problems. The signal they use interferes with my wifi. The bulbs aren't bright enough. They don't work in some places ordinary lights work, e.g. on a dimmer switch (even if I leave the switch at 100%). I can't replace the switch; I'm renting. The android app is annoying. Now they've gone and disabled desktop support. Not everyone wants to hook up their lights to a yelling device, Philips.
customer_reviews.author: solipsist

customer_reviews.title: Light color is pretty yellow, not a pleasant soft white glow!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed that the color of the white light is a bit yellow, kinda sickly compact fluorescent yellow. This is the most important part of a light! As for the connected home system, it’s actually hard for the family to switch over, I am glad it can still work as a normal light, just have to turn off then back on if not using the app. A physical remote switch would have helped the rest of the family who doesn’t want to try something new. The smart home system doesn’t work for you yet, you have to fit your life around it.
customer_reviews.author: Practitioner

customer_reviews.title: Way too yellow. Had to return.
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers have said, these are extremely YELLOW. I'm ok with a warm light but these are unnaturally yellow. I was replacing other LED bulbs that were a cool color and much brighter and these looked terrible in comparison. Definitely returning them. Sad... Was hoping to try out the Hue ecosystem but not willing to pay twice as much for bulbs that are actually white.
customer_reviews.author: Davemex

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Apple Homekit
customer_reviews.text: Works great with Apple Homekit. I recommend installing the Hue app first and setting up your devices there before syncing with Homekit.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Grant

customer_reviews.title: great lights once you get them working with an Amazon echo
customer_reviews.text: they work great but get ready to spend a few hours getting them setup with Amazon support - of course that is assuming you are going to use them with Alexa. I was on the phone for almost 45 minutes with Amazon. Phillips and Amazon really do need to get better integrated. I know some people have know problems getting these lights to work with Amazon echo's with relative ease, but when it doesn't work you REALLY need to have plenty of time in your calendar and lots of patience. Thus the reason this got only 4 stars and not five.
customer_reviews.author: New York

customer_reviews.title: Pictures Are Misleading - You Can't Go from Warm to Daylight
customer_reviews.text: Philips did a poor job accurately portraying what kind of hue these bulbs emit. They're very, very yellow. A picture in the product description indicates that within the app there's a setting to adjust between warm white (yellow) and daylight (white). This isn't the case. In order to be able to adjust the hue of the bulbs' light, you need to buy a different bulb that they sell (which also happens to be more expensive).
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Descz

customer_reviews.title: I feel like I am back at grandmas house before they had ...
customer_reviews.text: These "White" lights are VERY Yellow. Be aware. SUUUUPER Yellow. I feel like I am back at grandmas house before they had better light bulb technology. When glass was blue and a man delivered your milk...
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely horrible!!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely horrible!!!! If I could give negative stars, I would. I paid the $40 for the white and color ambiance bulb. It was never even recognized.... pointless. The other bulb (as I only tried one) worked with your phone...but not with speaking. It would not even work with Alexa... which was the whole idea of me getting this. There is NO support number anywhere on the crappy, so called instructions. There is also NO number for support on their app that I saw. This is one of the most expensive and horrible products that I have ever purchased. DO NOT BUY THIS!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Black Friday Deal!
customer_reviews.text: Paid $61 during a Black Friday deal and I just had the chance to set these up in our home. Very easy to setup and connect to both the app and the bridge. I was up and running in minutes. These are my first hue bulbs and experience with "smart" appliances and I have to say that I am very impressed with it. I was also able to connect to Apple's Home Kit so now I can even use Siri to turn the lights on and off. I'm already looking for other bulbs to replace around the house to have even more control over them.
customer_reviews.author: K. Mats

customer_reviews.title: The future is now
customer_reviews.text: This is the coolest thing ever! It’s helping me get one step closer into turning my home into Skynet. The hub connected immediately to the lightbulbs, although it was hard to tell which bulb was “1, 2, 3, or 4.” The setup was easy and the app works quite intuitively. I especially like the different preset lighting options and timers; no need for loud mechanical timers now. This product is seriously cool and I hope to eventually replace all my lightbulbs with these.
customer_reviews.author: Katie D.

customer_reviews.title: Works GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up. This was my first smart home hub. I placed the lights in my dining room table overhead light. The kids are always complaining the bright light from the old lights would give them a headache, now I can dim the lights and everyone is happy. This is GREAT! Especially when I have Alexa do it for me. Before they would unscrew the light bulb to turn off one or two lights. What a pain, but not any more. I like that I can control it from my phone, from Alexa and even when I am not home. I am adding to my smart home more and more.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Ace-Galvan

customer_reviews.title: These bulbs are AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loooove my philips hue bulbs! They are so easy to set up and work super well. I was having issues with constantly having to walk all over my apartment turning lights on and off to get the lighting right, and even so didn’t like that I couldn’t fin individual lights. Now I can do it all while sitting in my lounge chair and have some really nice presets for certain times of day. My ONLY qualm is that if you manually turn a light on or off then it erases your preset for that light. Other than that they are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Winston W.

customer_reviews.title: Great Set
customer_reviews.text: I bought this set for my son for Christmas. It's a wonderful value, and it works perfectly with his Echo Dot. He has hat the Dot for a little while but didn't have the hub to expand as he wanted. Now he's making all kinds of plans for what to do in his big house (lol). As a side note, while testing the hub and lights, he had Alexa call me. He was telling me about what he'd done and mentioned Alexa followed shortly by "cancel" ... which had Alexa hang up the phone. It was really funny, and he now knows not to say "her" name when on a call unless he means it!
customer_reviews.author: LauraM

customer_reviews.title: Warning, does not work with Kindle Fire HD tablet.
customer_reviews.text: Warning, does not work with Kindle Fire HD tablet and Alexa. Bought this for my parents who do not have smart phones but do have several kindle fire tablets and Alexa devices. The official HUE app on the amazon marketplace has not been updated for 3 years and will not find the hub. There is an unofficial paid app that does work but that app does not have support for echo/alexa...
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Karan

customer_reviews.title: Best in class. Great value. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: I never thought these would be a big deal. We use lamps with smart plugs all over the house, so I didn't see the point in bothering with expensive smart bulbs. I was totally wrong. These are great. So many smart plugs make a very quiet, high pitched ringing noise that annoys me. These don't. The ability to dim and adjust the lights is awesome. They animate smoothly when turning on, off, high, or low. It looks cool. The color is great, the usability is great. I didn't want to like these as much as I do, but they really are the best smart lighting system I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Elijah Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Impossible to creat Philips Hue Account to link to anything.
customer_reviews.text: This is a 100% piece of crap. I've waited hours, called support, got disconnected... I cannot get an email verification to create a Philips Hue account, so cannot link this gateway to anything except my phone, which is pointless living with multiple people in the house. Philips support keeps me on hold with bad music for about 10 minutes, then just hangs up. If you want something that works with, well, Anything, STAY AWAY FROM PHILIPS!!!!!! Going to be returning the opened package on Monday, since it is 100% garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Khend

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: I can't get these to work with my Alexa app. It keeps giving me an error message. I bought these specifically for use with Alexa because Amazon indicated that they worked with Alexa. Going to have to return them.
customer_reviews.author: T. Pizzity

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: I love how you can change the percentage of light you want in your room. You can also set up different “scenes” which are like pre-set modes for your lights. I got these so I could control my room with my Alexa. It works amazing! I am so happy I bought this purchase. I can just say “Alexa, turn on bedroom lights” and my lights will turn on! Also you don’t need an Alexa to control your lights. You can use the app that you’re told to download in the box. If you have an iPhone, you can even put your scenes on the widgets part of your phone for a more convenient use
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Easy and works great!
customer_reviews.text: The starter kit was easy to set up (not much to it). Placed them in my main bathroom and one lamp in living room. Connected the hub to my router and pressed the button. Downloaded the hue lamp app to my iPhone and my husbands iPhone. Updated the bulbs (that took a little time but not over 45 minutes maybe 10 minutes a bulb). Setup home kit on our iPhones and now use Siri to turn bathroom and lamp in living room lights on/off. Works great!
customer_reviews.author: KellyD

customer_reviews.title: These will not work with dimmer switch
customer_reviews.text: If you are buying these for a light fixture that uses a dimmer switch, DON'T BUY THEM. These bulbs do not work with alexa even if you have the dimmer all the way up. For example: I turned my switch on, put the dimmer all the way up to max brightness, then said "Alexa, turn off my dining room lights". The lights dimmed for a second and then turned back on to full brightness. I didn't see a disclaimer anywhere on the amazon listing before I bought these, so I figured i'd post a review with that information.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole R

customer_reviews.title: Great kit to use!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice lightbulb kit to use. They brighten and dim just like you can with a built in wall dimmer. If you own an Apple device, it connects with Home-Kit flawlessly and you can simply swipe up onto the control center and turn your lightbulbs on/off or brighten and dim them. This kit was on sale for $60 at the time that I bought them and it was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Shirley L.

customer_reviews.title: Great to incorporate into Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: Great product to incorporate into your Alexa device. Put light bulbs in, connected bridge directly to router, downloaded APP, updated bulbs and they work fantastic. Must link bulbs to your Alexa APP as well. In the Hue APP you can set the dimming percentage to your preference. Once complete, just tell Alexa to turn the lights on at 1%, 50% or 100%. Additionally, you can name each bulb or separate them by room. I did not have dimming capability on my lights. Now I do. I personally like them. Although, they may appear to be pricy, they bring value and much better lighting to your home with a longer life.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Allor

customer_reviews.title: PRETTY HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: I bought this starter set to work with Echo and three Dots. To be honest, the Hue Bridge and the bulbs set up nicely, and I could control all of the bulbs from the Hue app. The issue was in connecting it to the Echo and Dots; not the most straight-forward approach to marrying the Hue Bridge to the Echo platform. I think the apps should be more intuitive. In the end, I called Philips and talked to "Rhonda", who helped me work thru the app connections. I like the product (maybe a bit overpriced?), but the apps (Echo and Hue) need a simpler interface and instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Circle B Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful lighting system!
customer_reviews.text: This lighting system has changed my life! I travel quite a bit and these are better than timers because you can put them in places that are not wall sockets. I put one on my front and back porch. I know that the directions say the bulbs are not for outside, but my porch is covered and protected. It is wonderful to come home to a lit porch and lighted house. Also, when traveling, I set the routines to appear that someone is home. I love love love this product. Worth the investment and very easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup and Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I currently rent an apartment so I was not able to swap out the dimmers and switches for automated ones so this set was a great alternative. The setup was easy where all I did was plug in the hub to my ethernet switch and then installed the lights. Once I did that I downloaded the Philips Hue app and followed the instructions. Then I connected the system to my Echo and have been controlling the lights with my voice ever since. When I dont want to talk like during a movie I use the app to dim the lights or turn them off.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: I love Philips Hue
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this because I live in an apartment and can't change light fixtures or switches to use a system like Lutron Casseta. I love how its all plug and play. Just connect the hub to your router, screw in the bulbs, and use the app to connect everything. I also connected my Hue system to my google home to give me voice control. I lost wifi one day and had to actually use the light switches, and just about lost my mind. I was so used to being able to use my phone or voice. If you are looking to get into the smart home game, this is a great first step. Get it.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Lanclos

customer_reviews.title: RECENT UPDATE BROKE MY HUE
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly ...at first. Now, not so much. Philips did an 'Update' recently that broke the routines on my bulbs. I did a complete factory reset and re-install with no joy. I reset the routines and sometimes the bulbs work, most times they do not. Save yourself A LOT of money and aggravation and just use smartlife appliances. They seem to work great, are cheaper and are easier to set up and you have more choices when it comes to available components.
customer_reviews.author: hftsix

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Setup took ten minutes. Works flawlessly. We had no interest in color or operating room lights so these are great for our living rooms. The app is easy to understand and seems to be well setup. We haven't tried using the app off wifi but I'm not sure we will either. You can set any schedule you want on each individual light when home. 🤓
customer_reviews.author: Joe T

customer_reviews.title: You might get a crummy return rather than new product
customer_reviews.text: This is tricky. Ordered one of these kits. Loved it. Ordered another as a gift. Box is torn and it actually has a best buy tag on the side. Clearly a return. I ask for a replacement and new product. I get another previously opened package with missing tape and plastic that should be around the hub. Really????? I would add the picture of the best buy friends and family label, but it actually has someone's name on it, which would be the wrong thing to do.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Great Smart Bulbs!
customer_reviews.text: Love my smart lights...Works great with my google assistant(sorry Alexa). Lights are bright at 100%, and dimming them helps set the right mood for any occasion. The Hue App is probably the weak link in the entire thing. The geo-fencing within the app for the "home/Away" settings doesn't always work right(sometimes I come home and the bedroom light is still off, yet its set to come on at 20%). The "wake up" function though is amazing, and really helps me get up in the morning, subtly. Need to buy a few more sets to finish off the rest of the house, hoping the price comes down a little before then.
customer_reviews.author: Blake C.

customer_reviews.title: A little buggy, but still a great product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great starter kit for upgrading or updating your home with smart-home products. The system isn't perfect, however. For example, the hue app is clunky and buggy, but does receive updates fairly often. At least once per week, Alexa, which is linked to my system, fails to recognize an individual light or a grouping of lights, hence the four-star rating. Otherwise, it is a great piece of technology. I ordered one kit for me and one for my father who is starting to get into smart-home functionality.
customer_reviews.author: jbl

customer_reviews.title: Work as expected
customer_reviews.text: I use these smart bulbs and hub on a fairly large house and they work fine. I don't care for colored lights and these lights are dimmable and reasonably easy to program. The hub works well. The color temperature is toward the warm side like incandescent bulbs which is what we like. Can be controlled by wireless switches, phone apps, computer apps, voice assistants or timers. I have added more Hue bulbs to the hub and am happy with the system.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff2468

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this starter kit along with an Echo. Works flawlessly, I can control any connected lights from anywhere else in the house via my Echo or Dot, on either the Alexa or Philips app. The Philips app is very straightforward, initial setup was very easy and it's also easy to add additional bulbs at any time. The app also gives you the ability to create "routines"; for example, you can have your front porch light turn on at sunset and turn off at sunrise. You can also control the lights remotely when outside of your home network.
customer_reviews.author: SierraDelta

customer_reviews.title: Perfect smart lighting! Works great and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Phillips Hue is one of the best smart lighting systems on the market. I have tried a few others and but after I received my first Hue starter kit I decided to upgrade all of my lights to it. The Philips Hue White Smart Bulb Starter Kit I ordered has the basic A19 bulbs which are their most affordable bulbs. These lights can remotely turn on/off and even dim and are amazing for most locations. The bulbs in this kit can get extremely bright and even fade when turned on/off (something some of the other smart bulbs dont do.) The Hue app is one of the easiest smart home apps I've used and should be great even for beginners.
customer_reviews.author: Steven A

customer_reviews.title: Makes such a difference
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with the Echo Dot that I received for my birthday. I have a physical disability that makes it painful and difficult to get around. With these bulbs, I can turn my lights off and on without standing, turning, or walking. Sometimes my son leaves a light on in the other room. I replaced the lights he leaves on the most and now I can turn off all my lights without getting out of bed.
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: Not needed if you have the Echo +.
customer_reviews.text: If you have the Echo + you do not need this starter kit. You simply need the Phillips bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Kaypee

customer_reviews.title: Great product and supports my Smart home deployment scheme, buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I use a lot of different smart home products and Hue is definitely one of the better implemented devices out there. Pretty reliable comparatively when used with Apple HomeKit, great dimming range, great responsiveness. They still function through HomeKit if you cutoff WAN access from the hub directly via your router firewall rules. I do this on all my HomeKit devices to force their external comms to be routed through the HomeKit API which has end-to-end encryption. I still get remote control thru HomeKit, but Hue doesn’t have a direct link to the internet.
customer_reviews.author: AJO

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret it
customer_reviews.text: Setup was SO EASY!!! I gave each light an individual name ("dad's nightstand," "mom's nightstand," "living room table lamp," "living room floor lamp"), then grouped them into "master bedroom" and "living room". After setting them up with the Phillips Hue app and naming them, I then connected them to the Alexa app for voice control. I can now turn them on or off (or to a specified percentage) individually by name, or by the group name. I know it seems silly, but it's a game-changer. I'll be doing the kitchen and hall lights next. Also, the bridge works great fr all the lights in our 1900 sq. ft. home.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Householder

customer_reviews.title: You can turn on and off the lights really away from home!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic product, indeed works, really great how you can set routines for this bulbs to turn on/off according to your needs, or even that you can turn on the bulbs away from home....and when I say "away" I mean even from another country. I am from Costa Rica and recently travel to the US, and my neighbors don't even realize I was out for one week. I set routines for specific house areas to turn on/off according to sunrise and sunset, and for my kitchen and bedroom I manually turn on and off the lights every night so everyone things I was at home!!!
customer_reviews.author: DFGS

customer_reviews.title: Love the wake up function
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the smart light bulbs mostly for the wake up function which gradually turns on the light over 30 minutes based on the time I choose. I love it since I pretty much get up in the dark on winter. It makes it seem like morning. I love the hub because it gives me one place to control all my light bulbs and only one more device added to my internet.
customer_reviews.author: BHawkins

customer_reviews.title: Easy Setup, Work Excellently, Love this Brand now!
customer_reviews.text: I'm Thrilled with these lights. After purchasing a different brand - and having troubles, I tried these Philips Hue. They Work as they are supposed to! the iPhone app - Works, Google Assistant Work with them. Setup was Easy for me, and I'm not a network guru by any means. Instructions were Clear and well written and I loved the "Quick Start" setup guide! I will continue to add Hue products - these do what they say and are quality built. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Shaunagain

customer_reviews.title: The Philips Hue Smart Hub Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a hub to tie in with my Alexa devices. The Philips Hue hub was easy to setup and manage devices with the Hue app. If you want to manage it with your Alexa devices, you will need to go into the Skills area of the Alexa app and download the Philips Hue skill. This will enable you to add the bulbs into the Alexa app when they can then be managed via the app or via voice command.
customer_reviews.author: Dave P

customer_reviews.title: Don’t expect to control from outside of network
customer_reviews.text: It takes a lot for me to review a product (on either side). This product is garbage. The bridge stays connected outside of the network for about an hour or so. That means if you aren’t home the product is worthless. (Yes I have opened the bridge up on the app and meethue. I can control outside of the network for about an hour after we leave.) We got these for a second home so the purpose was the be able to control the lights while we aren’t there. Well can’t do that! In contrast the Feit bulbs I picked up at Costco have worked flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Knittel

customer_reviews.title: Works great in outdoor fixtures
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 5 months ago in November but wanted to wait until spring to see how well they held up outside. They’ve survived everything that winter threw at them, especially sleet and torrential rain storms, so I’m definitely recommending them for outdoor as well as indoor use. I don’t care for the app itself, particularly the way it integrates with HomeKit but that doesn’t detract from the product itself. I also bought three indoor candelabra bulbs for an outside post lamp and they have performed just as well.
customer_reviews.author: Davey Boy

customer_reviews.title: Works well but set-up could be a little less cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: Bought some of these as gifts and everybody seems to be pleased. I am told set-up is a little time-consuming and somewhat confusing, but works well once up and running. Be sure to label and each light as you go when setting up, otherwise if you install all of them before starting to set-up, you will have to go back around and figure out which one is which during set-up.
customer_reviews.author: fleastoo

customer_reviews.title: Multipurpose solution
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect solution for a number of unique problems. Do you need to dim lights in a ceiling fan?, this is a your answer. Want to turn on inside light before you enter the house? this is also your answer. Want to use your Alexa for something other than party tricks, the Hue gives her a real function. I read about other people having issues with losing connectivity, so far no issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Jim

customer_reviews.title: so much for amazon claiming a product is like new or very good
customer_reviews.text: i purchased this as a warehouse deal a number of months ago, but unfortunately didn't go to use it until now only to discover that someone had swapped the hub with a different ones and therefore the numbers didn't match and the hub wouldn't even turn on. so much for amazon claiming a product is like new or very good, i thought they were supposed to check things like that.
customer_reviews.author: A.Fleur

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product and Tech Support
customer_reviews.text: Bought these bulbs and hub and none of my devices could find the hud. Contacted support three times, got responses from three different people, who all gave em the same suggestions that failed to work. I've had no problems with any of my other smart home devices. I've already replaced them with TP-Link Kasa lights (which don't require a hub) and they integrated just fine. Very disappointed. Regardless of how much Philips Hue is spending in advertising, my experience is they should invest in techs who understand their product.
customer_reviews.author: NathanB

customer_reviews.title: For the Kingdom of Lazy Bachelors!
customer_reviews.text: In the era of smart home devices, one brand will rule them all. Never will I flip a light switch ever again within my home. I command my Echo dot, smart watch, or smartphone to bringeth light!! Seriously these lights are awesome, if you’re just as lazy or geeky as I am then you’ll purchase these lights for your home, office, or apartment. It’s a little on the pricier side for lightbulbs, but they’re awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Jonno

customer_reviews.title: No-Brainer Starter Kit
customer_reviews.text: This smart bulb system is a must. It completely transformed my small apartment. Philips does a great job of making it easy to set up and easy to use for the best (and priciest) in the smart bulb. The hub can be uses across all of Philips smart bulbs/lamps. Works great with Alexa and Siri. I think it's worth the extra cost to have a quality product, mobile app, and customer service. Wouldn't highly recommend. I 've already expanded mine beyond this great little starter kit.
customer_reviews.author: dpolk

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: Less than 3 years old and 3 of the 4 lightbulbs are completely dead or just don’t work. Warranty lasts for 1 year, the first lightbulb died a few weeks after the warranty expired. Two more lasted almost 3 years. One just doesn’t turn on at all and the other won’t turn off, it’s just constantly flickering dim light. Frustrating
customer_reviews.author: Shell 🐚

customer_reviews.title: Perfect upgrade to an old HUE V1 Bridge!
customer_reviews.text: Ive had Philips HUE White bulbs for 4 years, worked flawlessly. I needed to add some new bulbs AND update to the V2 HUE hub, so I bought this package. It was VERY easy to update and transfer all of my old bulbs, routines, rooms and settings from the old Version 1 hub to the new Version 2 hub! I can now fully re-integrate the system with the latest IOS and Android applications. I have 19 bulbs, and the new system is integrated 100%. Buy this kit for 4 very nice HUE WHITE bulbs and the new Version 2 base, you wont find a better price anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jhar75

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Works really well as long as everything goes according to Hoyle. However, when things go wrong, the system is difficult if not impossible to troubleshoot. For example, I had a power flicker that caused one of my bulbs to stop working. As far as I can tell, there is no way to manually reset a bald in case it gets scramble. This renders the bulb totally useless. I understand this is a problem with all Philips Hue bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: P. Estelle

customer_reviews.title: Easy install - Fire app didn't work
customer_reviews.text: This was one of the easiest Smart Home devices to set up. It was much easier than the outlet switches and garage door. The only bad thing is the Phillips Hue Fire app in the store didn't work on any of our Fire tablets. When asked to press the hub button it did nothing on the app. We were able to side load the APK file to use the standard Android Phillips Hue app. Amazon or Phillips needs to fix the app in the Fire store as it obviously has an issue. Our Echo (Alexa) devices found everything and work fine.
customer_reviews.author: BrokeDad

customer_reviews.title: I really like these lights
customer_reviews.text: I really like these lights. It was super easy to pair up and use out of the box. You simply screw in the light bulbs, connect the bridge to your router, download the app and then the app walks you through the rest. You're able to group them into rooms and then link them with Google Home (which was the reason I got them) to control them with your voice. They give off a good amount of light as well. The only reason I deducted a star is that I wish I didn't have to hardwire the Hue bridge to my router.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn R

customer_reviews.title: So far works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great sometimes Alexa has to be told several times to turn the lights off. I haven't had to reconnect the lights as I have seen in other reviews I would recommend these but they are a little high priced for what they can do.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Lemon Light
customer_reviews.text: Okay so i love the light, love the set up. The problem i have is one of the light bulbs burned out the DAY after I installed it. If they send em a replacement then I'd gladly change the review
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Need something to do to keep you busy.
customer_reviews.text: Worked flawlessly for 4 moths. Now it constantly disconnects. Alexa tells me phillps hue not responding. Too much time spent trouble shooting something that is meant to make life easier....not worth the trouble. Online help...some folks spent three hours with on the phone with support only to find out they need an updated hue ..never again.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: I have really liked these. I just hate that they cost so ...
customer_reviews.text: I have really liked these. I just hate that they cost so much. That is the only reason for the lack of a fifth star. I am more into these for the function they provide to the home and have not tried exploring the Scenes yet. The safety aspect of having the lights turn on and off on their own while on vaca or the ability to walk into a fully lite house is a great peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup - works great
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. Easy to setup and works great! I was trying to decide between TP Link or this Philips Hue. Decided to go with the Philips because of the ease of setting up rooms. I also have the TP Link which works fine but each bulb has to be set up individually in the Kasa app. I like the ease of the Philips better and will stay with this product in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Hank Werner

customer_reviews.title: Great starter kit!
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a great kit to get you started in the smart-home lighting realm. The 4 bulbs are fully dimmable via most controls (apple's siri, amazon alexa, google home, etc) and are a nice tint. THESE ARE NOT THE COLORED BULBS, these are white only. They are a slightly yellow tinged light so nice and warm.
customer_reviews.author: Avboden

customer_reviews.title: An awesome product
customer_reviews.text: I hated getting up in the night to reach for switch to turn off the bed lights. So I started the home automation project and these bulbs are a great addition. They are easy to install and integrate seamlessly with Alexa. Plus, I like that you can dim them down to 5% and they don’t even flicker. I was also skeptical that it wouldn’t look good as a naked bulb in my scone, but it just looks great. Highly recommend for any automation project The only downside is price $19/ bulb kinda steep.
customer_reviews.author: Siddharth

customer_reviews.title: Why did I wait so long!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, I am one of those mothers that will call their children down to turn off the lights. Well no more, lol and my kids are happy about this. The ease of asking Alexa to turn on or off the lights and use different scenes for the ambiance is great...or I can use the app on my phone to turn the lights on while I am away. I will purchase more of these.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Bridge bricked
customer_reviews.text: Bridge bricked after required update during initial installation using Android app - "update failed" message. Tried multiple power cycles and "factory reset" button to no avail. Totally useless. Will update if any resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Stettler

customer_reviews.title: Love them !
customer_reviews.text: I got these just for the heck of it since they were at 59.99.... oh boy, everyone loves them and I'm already ordering more bulbs. Gave it 4 since It would be great that instead of the hub to have to be hardwired that it would connect wireless. This way I would not need to throw a cable to where our bedrooms are at the other side of the house where the signal doesnt reach the lamps.
customer_reviews.author: friky19

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up, easy operation, and its fun to use!
customer_reviews.text: Set this up last night and its working great so far. I love being able to control the lights in the house with my voice! You can tell Siri to dim to specific percentages, moods, or just be on and off. For example, when I was going to be I said, "Hey Siri, dim the lights in the bedroom to 35%" and it created the perfect light for reading.
customer_reviews.author: AlexB

customer_reviews.title: Not enough light for rooms or open areas
customer_reviews.text: 60 watts bulbs do not give enough light for rooms and big areas. Installed them but after 2 days we started having headache and tired vision. Maybe I will use them in very small areas like a bathroom. Phillips hue does not have bulbs with higher wattage, so definetly wouldn’t recomend them.
customer_reviews.author: Hector Daniel Davalos Mtanous

customer_reviews.title: Expensive-ish, but worth the price!
customer_reviews.text: Philips Hue, as usual, delivers an excellent product and works quite trouble free. The only complaint I would have about these kits, and Hue series in general, would be the cost. They do deliver on the quality though with that added cost. The bulbs are beautiful, the light is excellent for the power consumption. The Hue hub and my SmartThings are playing quite nicely now for some time.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Bulbs work great and sync with my echo dot perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Bulbs work great and sync with my echo dot perfectly. Takes a little set up in the app to get all the rooms, scenes and things set up but once its done, you dont have to mess with it again. Love being able to control our bedroom lighting without having to get out of bed once we are all comfy! Will be buying more bulbs to expand into other rooms as well!
customer_reviews.author: Jazzy

customer_reviews.title: If you like configuring your devices once a week they're perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Constant disconnects between the bulb and hub. Try firmware updates and they don't solve any issues. Unreliable and expensive, Philips really needs to get it together with the smarthome stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Dave W

customer_reviews.title: Function well outside
customer_reviews.text: We love these lights! We use them on a covered porch. They are protected from the elements but not from temperature. We've been using them for a few months and so far we haven't had any problems with the app. Great for when you forget to turn off the lights and don't want to get up!
customer_reviews.author: LopsyBun

customer_reviews.title: Burnt out bulbs after 2 months
customer_reviews.text: I bought the starter 4 pack with the dot and after only 2 months of moderate use, I have 2 bulbs that are burnt out. I coughed up the cash because these should have lasted me 2 years minimum! As convenient as these are, they are NOT worth the price tag!
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna Scott

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works well with our Google Home devices. Wish there was a way to control multiple rooms at once more fine grained. Such as shut off all lights, but leave these lights on 5%. They are also a little more yellow than expected. Sad I have to pay $50 a bulb and get full on color changing ones just to make them less yellow.
customer_reviews.author: Krafts by Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Works great after you get it going
customer_reviews.text: One of the bulbs died immediately. The other 3 work perfectly with Alexa so it's great. Be wary that these can dim only if a dimmer switch hasn't already been installed. I had a dimmer switch previously so I just swapped it out before I used this product. Also this is not a multicolor lighting experience. This just satisfies that itch for telling someone else to turn off the lights for you.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best smart light ever.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly how I wanted them to. I have an old house with very old walls and electric. My living room light was insanely bright and I wanted a way to dim it easily. I paired this with amazon Echo and et viola! Works like a charm. Haven’t had an issue yet and have been using this for about a month now. Definitely 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: I love these bulbs for reading lights
customer_reviews.text: I hate getting up in the middle of the night to turn off my reading light! Being able to adjust the light with the dimmer funtion makes ot so I'm not bothering other people if I'm up later than they are. I'm planning on getting more bulbs and converting my whole home so I can turn on and off whole rooms with a tap of a button!
customer_reviews.author: David Horning

customer_reviews.title: Phillips hue universe
customer_reviews.text: If you’ve invested in Phillips hue universe this is a great addition especially if the power goes out with the rechargeable battery. The hue lights/bulbs will cost you but I’ve never had any issues with them. Now that the house is pretty much completed I’m happy with all of the hue products.
customer_reviews.author: PoussoNR

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: After buying, i don’t get how anyone can write a negative review. They’re great, now There’s no more forgetting to leave a light on for the dogs if we’re not home at night. Simply go into the app (hue or Alexa) and turn them on. Love them! The whole house will have them eventually.
customer_reviews.author: Scott mcgill

customer_reviews.title: I love being about to ask the lights to be dimmed ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I no longer fight over who needs to get out bed to turn the bedroom lights on or off. We simply ask Alexa and it's done. I love being about to ask the lights to be dimmed and since they are in a ceiling fan with 3 bulbs I can ask Alexa to turn off specific bulbs if I go to sleep before my husband.
customer_reviews.author: RunnerGirlDE

customer_reviews.title: Good idea however
customer_reviews.text: Good idea however, bridge constantly fails network connection and associated app is just as bad. It worked successfully for 1 week and then began suffering intermittent failures. Online blogs, support feedback, and customer reviews are all unanswered and ignored. If bridge fails, enjoy having now paid a massive premium for regular bulbs because you will unfortunately get no help and no resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these lights
customer_reviews.text: So I got this for Prime Day 2019. Got curious here recently about getting smart bulbs for my house. I got these and they were easy to set up, easy to integrate with Alexa. I have them in my living room and one of the bedrooms. I set up a routine with Alexa to turn on and off the lights in each room. They work seamlessly! I definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lights
customer_reviews.text: I got these to create an auto lighting aspect. Mostly to be violently awoken in the morning so my fat butt would get to the gym. They work and I slightly hate them for that but overall they are cool. The app was a bit confusing at first. I recommend doing one bulb at a time. They are very bright which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Replacement?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in January of 2018 and now it’s stopped working. I’ve tried unplugging it and reconnecting, still nothing. How do I go about replacing it since it’s under 2 years? I feel this should have a longer life expectancy than 22 months.
customer_reviews.author: Just Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Not quite what I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up, except I am not sure how you are supposed to tell which bulb is which but I either guessed right or it's easier than I thought. Connected to Alexa easily and voice control is nice. Kind of fun actually. I am disappointed that I didn't realize these bulbs could not change color. It clearly says white on the packaging but all of the descriptions say they change color. I put them all in my kitchen where I want bright white light and will try to get colors next time.
customer_reviews.author: Katy L

customer_reviews.title: Good if you need them... but do you?
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would need something like this, but we're running an airbnb out of our house, so it's good to be able to control the outside lights and put them on timers etc when we're not here. Other than that though smart bulbs seem like an overpriced gimmick.
customer_reviews.author: PghNeuro

customer_reviews.title: ... home and I've started the transition to all things smart and this was the perfect kit for setting up ...
customer_reviews.text: We just moved into our first home and I've started the transition to all things smart and this was the perfect kit for setting up our first smart lights. We use these in our bedroom and living room and there is nothing as satisfying as not having to get out of bed once you're comfortable for the night just to turn off the lights. Super easy to set up and use. Will be purchasing more!
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: ... a Google Home Mini for Christmas and they work beautifully. You can turn on and off individual lights ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these after I got a Google Home Mini for Christmas and they work beautifully. You can turn on and off individual lights or group them into rooms using the app or Google Home (aka Google Assistant). And with the app, you can setup routines to do things like turn off the lights when you leave home or turn them on when the sun sets. The only downside is that you need the hub in order to connect to these lights and the hub requires a wired ethernet connection.
customer_reviews.author: Briant D.

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Received a smart speaker as a gift and decide to give these smart bulbs a try. It is really nice to set up timers, turn on/off and dim/brighten my lights without having to touch the switch. Although I would've like it if it can get even dimmer than what it is currently capable of. I have found that it works best with stand alone lamps in individual rooms and also exterior porch lights. Definitely will look for more of these to expand my smart home lighting.
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Fun way to light your home
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. So far so good. I am not sure yet of course how long these bulbs will last only time will tell. They connected to the bridge and updated without trouble and I was able to set up so my lights come on at certain times and turn off too. One of my kids flipped the light switch and messed it up, but it was easy to reset it in the Hue app. Can't wait to get more lights to go with this.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The only brand of Wi-Fi bulbs you should consider.
customer_reviews.text: This should be your go to for automated lights and the brand to use for voice activation. I bought my first set in 2013 and I’m still using the bulbs. I have my lights on constantly so they pass the value test on cost per bulb for their lifetime. This is a game changer for how you live.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy Chen

customer_reviews.title: Works poorly with Apple Home Kit. Intermittent "No response" ...
customer_reviews.text: Works poorly with Apple Home Kit. Intermittent "No response" among various bulbs often. Completely frustrating. If the manufacturer states it will work with an app it should. Several blogs online about this issue. Get is straight Philips. I would advise not to purchase if you want to use it with Siri.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You'll never know how useful these are until you start using them
customer_reviews.text: So many features, yet simplicity is embedded into the app. Works great with the Google Assistant and I love the wake up/go to bed routines and how the lights automatically turn on when I arrive home. Save energy and buy these, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: JT

product_meta.title: Philips Hue White A19 60W Equivalent LED Smart Bulb Starter Kit (4 A19 White Bulbs and 1 Hub Compatible with Amazon Alexa Apple HomeKit and Google Assistant)
product_meta.description: Size:4 Pack| Style:StandardAutomate your lights for peace of mind. Control your Philips Hue white lights from anywhere in the world, as long as you have internet. Or automate your lights to make it seem like you’re home when you’re not. Hue bridge included. Works with Amazon Alexa, Apple Homekit and Google Assistant.
feature_bullets: VOICE ACTIVATED: The Philips Hue White 4-Pack Smart Bulb Starter Kit works with Alexa for voice control (smart hub required and included, Alexa device sold separately)

AUTOMATE YOUR SMART HOME: Enhance your home with soft white smart lighting, controlled remotely wherever you are. Automate your lighting experience with the Philips Hue App, and ensure you never come home to a dark house

TAKE CONTROL: Each kit contains 4 Philips Hue White A19 60W Energy Star Certified LED Smart bulbs (able to fit most lamps, overhead lights, and 4-inch recessed cans ); Philips Hue Hub that can reliably control up to 50 Hue lights without slowing your WiFi; three-year warrantee

EASY INSTALLATION: To install, simply screw the smart bulbs into your desired smart light location, download the Hue mobile app and pair your Hue Hub. Control smart-bulb-equipped lamps and overhead lights via the Philips Hue App
EXPAND YOUR PHILIPS HUE ECOSYSTEM: Easily expand your lighting system with hue accessories (sold separately), such as a Hue Dimmer Switch, Hue Tap, or Hue Motion Sensor

specifications.Included Components: Hue White A19 LED bulbs; Hue Bridge
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,387 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
